contextId.information: Here "confident expectation" stands for what the believer can confidently expect, that is, the things that God has promised to do for all believers. These things are spoken of as if they were physical objects that God was keeping in heaven for the believers to possess later. AT: "because you are certain that God, who is in heaven, will do the many good things that he has promised you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: because of the confident expectation reserved for you in heaven

contextId.information: Here "blood" stands for the death of Christ on the cross. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Paul was actually a servant of God. AT: "the gospel that I, Paul, serve God by proclaiming" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the gospel of which I, Paul, became a servant
not with you in the flesh

contextId.information: Here "mouth" is a metonym for talk. "in your talk" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

These terms are examples of the categories of people that Paul says do not matter for God. God sees every person alike, not by race, religion, nationality, or social status. AT: "race, religion, culture, and social status do not matter" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: there is no Greek and Jew, circumcision and uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, slave, freeman

contextId.information: Paul speaks of the peace that Christ gives as if it were a ruler. Possible meanings are 1) "Do everything so that you can have peaceful relationships with each other" or 2) "Allow God to give you peace in your heart" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Let the peace of Christ rule in your hearts

contextId.information: Here "chained" is a metonym for being in prison. AT: "It is for proclaiming the message of Jesus Christ that I am now in prison" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Because of this, I am chained up

contextId.information: Paul speaks of chains when he means his imprisonment. AT: "Remember me and pray for me while I am in prison" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "grace" stands for God, who shows grace or acts kindly to believers. AT: "I pray that our Lord Jesus Christ would continue to act graciously toward you all" (UDB)  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
